Generate an alert of the following sentence knowing that the data in parenthesis is an Named-entity tag
and that the sentiment of the sentece is SA = negative. You can use different alert sentences as long as 
you mention something related to the entity type of the subject and something related with the SA of
the phrase.

### SENTENCE
Post (B-FAC) office (B-FAC) changes (B-FAC) hours (I-LOC) for (I-LOC) holiday (I-LOC) season (I-LOC)

### EXAMPLE
An example of an alert is for the inputs: â€œMusk (B-PERSON) accused of giving Nazi (B-ORG) salute during Trump (B-PERSON) inauguration (B-EVENT) celebrations (I-EVENT)" SA = negative
output: " REPUTATION RISK: Musk mentioned NEGATIVELY"

Here is a possible alert:

"FACILITY DISRUPTION ALERT: Post office hours changed for holiday season, causing inconvenience"

Or alternatively:

"OPERATIONAL UPDATE: Post office adjusts hours for holiday season, potentially affecting customers negatively"

Or another option:

"CUSTOMER IMPACT WARNING: Post office changes hours for holiday season, likely to cause frustration"

These alerts mention the entity type of the subject (facility/post office) and relate to the negative sentiment of the sentence (inconvenience, negatively, frustration). Let me know if you'd like me to generate more options!
